title: Dogara urges support for establishment of North-East Development Commission
text:
Home » News » Dogara urges support for establishment of North-East Development Commission Dogara urges support for establishment of North-East Development Commission On 8:55 pm In News by Okogba Comments 
The Speaker, House of Representatives, Yakubu Dogara, has urged Nigerians to support the establishment of the North-East Development Commission (NEDC). 
The speaker gave the advice on Wednesday at the National Assembly, Abuja during a meeting with delegation from the North-Eastern states, led by Gov. Kashim Shettima of Borno. 
Dogara said that the House would put mechanisms in place to ensure effective management of the commission, if the bill seeking its establishment is passed and assented by the president. Yakubu Dogara 
Dogara further said that the commission, when established, would be monitored for the restoration, rehabilitation and development of the region. 
The speaker also said that propose commission would provide a legal framework with which donor agencies and other interested parties could assist in the development process. 
He further stated that legal action could be taken against the commission if any law or agreement was breached. 
Dogara said that the commission would go a long way in improving the lives of Nigerians in the region and turns ‘’the ruins of the North- East to glory.” 
According to him, the commission will create jobs for the teeming unemployed youths in the region, thereby reducing the likelihood of insurgency among them. 
“We know what we felt and we know what we can do if this commission is established,” he said. 
The speaker, who expressed confidence that the bill would get the assent of President Muhammadu Buhari urged the stakeholders to continue to advocate the establishment of the commission. Okogba
